titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: I attended the Bishop in the Galilee where a miserable little function was performed, by which a malefactor–parson named Greenwood was deposed & degraded from his Orders.

Then I presided at a meeting of the Choir–School Committee in the Chapter House. We decided to continue the combination of a Minor Canonry with the Mastership of the Choir school, & to advertise accordingly.
I corrected proofs of the little volume of sermons which Hugh Rees is publishing for me.
I attended Evensong in the Cathedral.

body.p: Stafford Northcote of St Andrew's, Westminster, came to stay the night. Mrs Hodgson Fowler, Miss Headlam, & Knowling came to dinner.
